body: Came back to this to clarify how bad my thinking is, I made this with black's knight getting taken first, when I am pretty sure it's whites, also kazuna is more likely to blunder than megumin (his personality makes me think so). Idk their elos in chess, I assume they are beginners because of the first showcase of the bird but I still don't have a good board setup for the second part.
↓ Could also be something else↓ wtf autocorrect, and I wasn't done ;-; also takes↓not tastes.

Wondering what the board and set up would have to be for the knight to be the first piece gone. Kings pawn opening: king's knight variation. Black playing Nc6, white responding d3(and alternating between colors),blacks king bishop going for b4, probably blocked b by Nc3, Kf6, g3 or Be2, then d5, white takes, black tastes, white takes, knight taken? i know is been 2 years and you may or may not still be alive but here ya go i googled it for ya

Monosubstituted: A molecule or functional group in which only one hydrogen has been replaced by another atom or group. These substituents are not limited to methyl groups as shown here. When considering alkene stability, only carbon substituents matter (i.e., -CH3 or -Ph matter but -Br or -OCH3 do no
